Ok, do you want to keep this in a PR while we figure out what the issue really is?
I would keep this open for a week as we investigate the issue. If we have no resolution until then we can merge this in as a some-what robust fall-back.

I updated sparkDML.sh to use `--master yarn --deploy-mode client` as default and removed 
`--conf spark.akka.frameSize=128`.  Also removed spark.akka.frameSize reference from recommended Spark configuration settings in spark-batch-mode and spark-mlcontext-programming-guide docs.

Note although I removed `spark.akka.frameSize` from sparkDML.sh and recommended settings, I'm not sure if I should instead replace with `--conf spark.rpc.message.maxSize=128` since it also means:
"Maximum message size (in MB) to allow in "control plane" communication; generally only applies to map output size information sent between executors and the driver. Increase this if you are running jobs with many thousands of map and reduce tasks and see messages about the RPC message size."
Niketan, please give me sometime for compiling `ptx` with NVVM.
LGTM. Thank you @krishnakalyan3

Hi @mboehm7 , can you please review this. Thanks.

Hi @prithvirajsen , can you please help resolve this. A simple implementation of scalable svd() with existing scalable `qr()`. The important code snippet.
```
[Q, R] = qr::QR(X, nb); //scalable qr decomposition, nb = no. of blocks

 [U, S, V] = svd(R); //computes svd locally
```
based on eqn no. (1.3) in [Research Paper](https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/6ada/cebd3a7604ac0627743cc315a2ebefd0bfb0.pdf)
cc @dusenberrymw

  • org.apache.sysml.test.integration.functions.recompile.IPAConstantPropagationTest.testConstantPropagationNoUpdateBranchRemovalNoIPA

In general, this looks very good @gweidner, but I would recommend to leave the internal compiler/runtime constants and opcodes as they are (i.e., CEIL) in favor of brevity. Also, we might want to support both "ceiling" and "ceil" (we can map both to the internal ceil in BuiltinFunctionExpression). Just out of curiosity, I double checked R and SparkR: ceiling is the base function in R but there are R packages that define ceil as an alias too; SparkR also supports both.

Thank you for reviewing Matthias!  Supporting both ceil and ceiling is a great idea so I'll make corresponding updates here and use `ceil` as opcode.
+1 for supporting both ceiling as well as ceil.
@dusenberrymw any additional comments ?
Thank you Niketan!  I'll also plan on updating python defmatrix.py to support both as well.
Niketan, I am missing out something here. üòï
Thanks @dusenberrymw  ... I will merge :+1:

I've restored `ceil` built-in function and added `ceiling` with both mapped to same existing opcode which helped reduce scope of changes (thank you @mboehm7 for recommending).  Kept existing dml scripts as-is (i.e., use `ceil`).  Updated python matrix to allow both `ceil` and `ceiling`.

Added new test cases/script for `ceiling` but only under `RUNTIME_PLATFORM.HYBRID` mode since RoundTests disabled for `SPARK`.  Verified RoundTest and CPlanVectorPrimitivesTest locally and full tests passed in referenced PR build.  Manually tested python matrix in pyspark shell:

t = m1.ceil()
t
This matrix (mVar3) is backed by below given PyDML script (which is not yet evaluated). To fetch the data of this matrix, invoke toNumPy() or toDF() or toPandas() methods.
mVar1 = load(" ", format="csv")
mVar3 = ceil(mVar1)
save(mVar3, " ")

t.toDF()
SystemML Statistics:
Total execution time:           0.015 sec.
Number of executed Spark inst:  1.

DataFrame[C0: double, C1: double, C2: double]

t2 = m2.ceiling()
t2
This matrix (mVar4) is backed by below given PyDML script (which is not yet evaluated). To fetch the data of this matrix, invoke toNumPy() or toDF() or toPandas() methods.
mVar2 = load(" ", format="csv")
mVar4 = ceiling(mVar2)
save(mVar4, " ")

https://sparktc.ibmcloud.com/jenkins/job/SystemML-PullRequestBuilder/2141/

LGTM - thanks @gweidner. In a subsequent change, we should cleanup these tests you mentioned. These conditional tests are from a time when we did not pull in Spark by default. We should make them all unconditional and add the necessary spark setup (similar to all the other tests) where required. We can probably identify them via a simple search for the used predicate.

I guess the test is failing because the output names are not set correctly. Btw, this is a very old (+5 years) way of running test scripts. Unfortunately, there are still some of these instances in our test suite. You can use `FullStringComparisonTest` or most of the matrix tests as a template. This makes the input/output handling very explicit and should easily allow us to resolve this issue.

Hi @deroneriksson , the following files seems to use `CAST_AS_SCALAR` opcode, shall we use some other opcode at these places.
`hops/TernaryOp.java` [L231](https://github.com/apache/systemml/blob/3ca05353593e7847dc6d6a7e862e323ffa96bfcc/src/main/java/org/apache/sysml/hops/TernaryOp.java#L231)
`QuaternaryOp.java`    [L438](https://github.com/apache/systemml/blob/8dbc93022a01aae309354c7b2b2f0eee9ec11aad/src/main/java/org/apache/sysml/hops/QuaternaryOp.java#L438)

Hi @j143,
I once tried changing CAST_AS_SCALAR but changed it back after feedback from @mboehm7 (see https://github.com/apache/systemml/pull/130). Perhaps @mboehm7 can advise WRT this issue.
So, we need to differentiate PyDML(`scalar`) & DML(`as.scalar`)  `BuiltinFunctionExpression`, may be with a boolean flag, for language level warning.

There is no need to change the internal operator types or opcodes. Updating the scripts to use as.scalar would be fine though. However, in this specific instance I would recommend to rather delete this test script and reference  `scripts/algorithms/LinearRegCG.dml` instead (see `codegen.AlgorithmLinregCG` for an example).

@niketanpansare could you please let me know more about the compilation issue.
Done!

Consider the following scenario:
- The user runs a performance test and the data is in script/temp directory 
- The user wants to rerun the test again with new changes: git pull, followed by mvn package 
- Since maven packages the script folder into jar, maven hangs without any warning or error.
